rules: Rule1: Provided that John works in the Metro Region, it follows that he does not work in a Dry County.
Rule2: In the event that John violates the law regarding Minor Sale, then John is a licensed bartender.
Rule3: Whenever John violates the law regarding After Hours, he is a licensed bartender.
Rule4: Under the condition that John is caught by an Inspector, John's license is suspended.
Rule5: John is caught by an Inspector, or John is reported by a Colleague.
Rule6: Provided that John is reported by a Colleague, then John violates the law regarding Minor Sale or John violates the law regarding After Hours.
Rule7: If John's license is suspended, then John's license is revoked.
Rule8: In the event that John is investigated by the Board, then if John's license is revoked, John receives a fine.
Rule9: Provided that John applies for a Liquor License, he meets the Residency requirement.
Rule10: Whenever John meets the Age requirement, then John is not allowed to serve Minors.
Rule11: If John submitted an Application, then, if John applies for a Liquor License, John meets the Age requirement.
Rule12: John submitted an Application or John paid a Fee.
Rule13: In the event that John paid a Fee, then, if John applies for a Liquor License, John meets the Age requirement.
Rule14: Provided that John passes the background check, it is not the case that John has a criminal record.
Rule15: John passes the background check or John provides references.

Rule16: Provided that John requires a hearing, then either John's Application is approved immediately or if John is reviewed by the Commissioner, then if John provides references, John does not have a criminal record.
Rule17: John requires a hearing or John experiences delayed processing.

Rule18: In the event that John has authorization to Serve Alcohol, then if it is not the case that if John is not a licensed bartender then John does not have the skill of Mixology, John has the Basic certificate.

Rule19: Whenever John completes Safety training, then, if John experiences delayed processing, either John's Application is approved immediately or if John is reviewed by the Commissioner, then if John provides references, John does not have a criminal record.
Rule20: Provided that John passes a course, then either John attends a seminar or if John is not a licensed bartender, then John does not have the skill of ID Checking.
Rule21: In the event that John takes a refresher, then either John attends a seminar or if John is not a licensed bartender, then John does not have the skill of ID Checking.
Rule22: Under the condition that John studies manually, John passes a course.
Rule23: John studies manually or John uses an online portal.
Rule24: Provided that John uses an online portal, John takes a refresher.
Rule25: Whenever John is authorized in Region A, John has authorization to Work an Event.
Rule26: John is authorized in Region A or John is authorized in Region B.
Rule27: If John is authorized in Region B, then John is authorized in Region C.
Rule28: In the event that John is authorized in Region C, John is authorized in Region D.
Rule29: Whenever John is authorized in Region D, John has authorization to Work at a Bar.
Rule30: John hires a lawyer or, if it is not the case that John appeals the decision or if John's license is suspended then John receives a fine, John accepts the penalty.
Rule31: John represents himself or John does not hire a lawyer.
Rule32: In the event that John receives a Temporary permit, then, if John meets the Residency requirement, John meets the Age requirement.
Rule33: Under the condition that John's permit is expired, John's permit is not renewed.
Rule34: John's application is complete or, if John applies for a Liquor License, John meets the Age requirement.
Rule35: John's application is incomplete or it is not the case that John's application is complete.

Rule36: Provided that John attends an interview, then, if John experiences delayed processing, either John's Application is approved immediately or if John is reviewed by the Commissioner, then if John provides references, John does not have a criminal record.
Rule37: In the event that John passes the interview, then if it is not the case that if John does not attend an interview then John's interview is waived, John's interview is failed.
Rule38: Whenever John has a clean record, it is not the case that John has a criminal record.
Rule39: Provided that John is verified by the Police, John has a clean record.
Rule40: John is verified by the Police or John provides an affidavit.
Rule41: John's Document is notarized or John is self-certified.
Rule42: Provided that John is self-certified, then, if John provides an affidavit, John has a clean record.
Rule43: Whenever John passes the practical exam, John's certification is not denied.
Rule44: John passes the practical exam or John passes the written exam.
Rule45: Under the condition that John passes the written exam, John's certification is not denied.
Rule46: Provided that John demonstrates the Pouring skill, John completes Safety training.
Rule47: In the event that John demonstrates the Mixing skill, John completes Safety training.
Rule48: Whenever John is hired by Bar X, John is employed as a Bartender.
Rule49: John is hired by Bar X or John demonstrates the Pouring skill or John demonstrates the Mixing skill.

Rule50: Provided that John has authorization to Work an Event, then if it is not the case that if John is not a licensed bartender then John does not have the skill of ID Checking, John has the Advanced certificate.

Rule51: Under the condition that John has authorization to Work at a Bar, then if it is not the case that if John is not a licensed bartender then John does not have the skill of ID Checking, John has the Advanced certificate.
Rule52: John works in a Dry County or John has authorization to Work an Event or John has authorization to Work at a Bar.
Rule53: Provided that it is not the case that if John's Document is notarized then if John provides an affidavit John has a clean record, John's verification is pending.
Rule54: Under the condition that it is not the case that if John's Document is notarized then if John provides an affidavit John has a clean record, John's verification is not pending.
Rule55: In the event that it is not the case that if John receives certification then if John does not complete Safety training John retakes training, John's certification is denied.
Rule56: Provided that John does not have authorization to Serve Alcohol, John works in a Restricted Zone.
Rule57: In the event that John does not complete Safety training, John fails an exam.
Rule58: Under the condition that John does not complete Safety training, John does not retake training.
Rule59: Provided that John does not receive a Temporary permit, John's permit is expired.
Rule60: Whenever John does not receive a Temporary permit, John's permit is renewed.
Rule61: Under the condition that John is not a licensed bartender, John has the skill of Mixology.
Rule62: If John is not a licensed bartender, John is allowed to serve Minors.
Rule63: Whenever John is not a licensed bartender, John has a criminal record.
Rule64: Provided that John is not a licensed bartender, John has the skill of ID Checking.
facts: Fact1: John works in the Metro Region.
Fact2: John is investigated by the Board.
Fact3: John applies for a Liquor License.
Fact4: John is reviewed by the Commissioner.
Fact5: John passes the interview.
Fact6: John receives certification.
Fact7: It is not the case that John receives a fine.
Fact8: John does not have the Basic certificate.
Fact9: John's Application is not approved immediately.
Fact10: John does not fail an exam.
Fact11: John does not attend a seminar.
Fact12: John does not work in a Restricted Zone.
Fact13: John does not appeal the decision.
Fact14: John does not accept the penalty.
Fact15: John does not represent himself.
Fact16: John's application is not incomplete.
Fact17: John's interview is not waived.
Fact18: John's interview is not failed.
Fact19: John does not have the Advanced certificate.
Fact20: John is not employed as a Bartender.
